Activity: Morning coffee and email triage. Respond to any feedback received on the Gap Analysis report.
Schedule a follow-up meeting with the EHR vendor (@EHRVendor) to discuss the findings of the Gap Analysis report and explore potential solutions.

Meet with the EHR vendor (@EHRVendor) to present the Gap Analysis report and discuss potential solutions to address the identified limitations. Explore options for customization, integration, or alternative workflows.

Document the key takeaways from the meeting with the EHR vendor, including proposed solutions, timelines, and cost estimates. Share this information with internal stakeholders. @ITPM-1, @ClinLead-1, @HIS-1, @HIS-2.
Lunch! Maybe browse some open-source EHR projects for inspiration.

Prepare a detailed communication plan outlining how the hospital's specific requirements for influenza data collection, reporting, and analysis will be communicated to the EHR vendor. Define communication channels, frequency, and key stakeholders.
Draft a formal communication to the EHR vendor (@EHRVendor) clearly articulating the hospital's requirements for influenza data. Include specific examples, use cases, and reporting expectations.
Review the draft communication with @ITPM-1 and @ClinLead-1 to ensure it accurately reflects the hospital's requirements and aligns with the project goals.
Finalize the communication to the EHR vendor based on feedback received from @ITPM-1 and @ClinLead-1. Ensure clarity, conciseness, and accuracy.
